sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A courtly new ballad of the princely wooing of the faire maid of London, by King Edward. To the tune of, Bonny sweet Robbin.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
Printed for Henry Gosson, London : [1640?]
Verse: "Faaire [sic] angell of England, thy beauty most bright ..." Publication date suggested by STC. In two parts; part 2 has caption title: The faire maid of Londons answer to King Edwards wanton love. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
